snippet: One senior official in Tehran hinted at a modest compromise ahead of planned nuclear talks, while another official rejected preconditions for the discussions.
abstract: Top Iranian officials offer mixed signals about the country's willingness to make compromises on its nuclear program in advance of the planned resumption of nuclear talks with a group of six global powers; the disparity in remarks made by the officials seems to reflect continued debate among the Iranian elite over the handling of negotiations.
lead_paragraph: One senior official in Tehran hinted at a modest compromise ahead of planned nuclear talks, while another official rejected preconditions for the discussions.

headline.seo: Iran Sends Mixed Signals Ahead of Nuclear Talks
headline.main: Iranian Officials Send Mixed Signals as Nuclear Talks Near Resumption
headline.print_headline: Iranian Officials Send Mixed Signals as Nuclear Talks Near Resumption
